comment.author: 11953092@N04
comment._content: Newman was appointed as a Temporary 2nd Lt on 12 October 1915 as per the London Gazette www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29333/pages/10285/page.pdf

comment.author: 61948930@N07
comment._content: Probably 9th (Service) Battalion owing to the pioneer collar dogs below the North Staffs badges.

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Born second quarter of1894. The 1901 census  records him living at 63 Lichfield Grove, Finchley with his parents and older brother [the property still exists].
Father -  Gerald Riley Newman b1848 West Dean, Brighton - Stockbroker
Mother - Ada Sarah Newman b1863 Islington
Brother - Gerald Leslie b1891Finchley
2 srevants
The national Probate (index of Wills & Administrations) records the following
“NEWMAN Cyril Arnell of 160 Marylebone Road, Middlesex. Second-lieutenant died 28th April 1917 in France. Administration London 2 November to Ragnhid Torp Newman, widow. Effects £187 10s."
He had only married Ragnhid in 1917 [date unknown] so they can only have been married a matter of a few months, she died in 1976. A living member of his family has posted photographs of his grave on Ancestry.com

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits] Ragnhild Torp Newman died 1976 Middlesex Death index Note spelling of Ragnhild. According to findagrave.com Newman is buried in: Aubigny Communal Cemetery Extension Aubigny-en-Artois Nord-Pas-de-Calais Region, France Plot: VI. D. 9. That would be at the northern boundary of this map www.kinnethmont.co.uk/1914-1918_files/cemetery-plans/aubi...

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content: My mistake, looking at my original notes, I had spelled it correctly [with the L]. Seems my typing is not up to par!
